title: Travis Scott 'to get operation' after dislocating knee in nasty stage fall
text:
Travis Scott hurt his knee at the Rolling Louder festival (Picture: Getty)

Travis Scott might have to go under the knife, after hurting his knee at the Rolling Loud festival.

The Sicko Mode rapper was performing at the New York festival, when he was jumping up and down, being his energetic self.

However, it went slightly wrong when the 28-year-old landed badly, dislocating his knee on stage.

Which is not ideal.

Insiders have now claimed Kylie Jenner’s ex will be going under the knife as soon as possible.

Sources told TMZ doctors ‘would like to wait another day or two before conclusively deciding if surgery is needed, or if the knee can just heal on its own’.

Travis dislocated his knee while on stage (Picture: Getty)

But they added that the dad-of-one wants to opt for the surgery to get himself back to full health ASAP.

Travis messed up his knee over the weekend, while performing at Rolling Loud festival in the big apple.

He quite literally hit the stage at Citi Field, when he fell while performing Butterfly Effect.

In footage shot by a concert-goer, the rapper could be seen bending over and holding his leg while saying: ‘I ain’t going to lie, I think I just broke my knee right now. But this show cannot stop.’

He then told the audience to ‘put [their] middle fingers to the sky’ before launching into his next song No Bystanders.

Travis Scott and Kylie Jenner split recently (Picture: Getty)

What a total pro.

Travis hasn’t had the easiest few months, following his split from ex Kylie Jenner recently.

But, despite their relationship breaking down, he insisted that daughter Stormi is the only priority for himself and the Keeping Up With The Kardashians star.

Discussing his bond with the little one, he told GQ Germany: ‘Stormi is like a battery. I’ve gotten so much energy from her. She has shown me so many things that I never understood. I only got it once she was here.

‘Fatherhood is the most impactful thing in my life.

‘To see your daughter getting a little older every day is the most magical experience in the world. I’ve also developed so much passion. I feel things I never felt before.’

All the feelings.
